eventName: Lone Dance at the Old Factory
storyName: Lone Dance at the Old Factory
storyInfo: Windflit returns home after his job search falls through. The old factory continues to plod on, its workers keeping faith in the future.

attributes.text: This product is used to treat chronic insomnia, helping the user fall asleep and improving sleep quality.
Consult your doctor or pharmacist before use, or for any questions.
It is normal to have difficulty falling asleep in the first several nights of use. Contact your doctor if this continues.

attributes.content: Monday
Mom, Dad, I'm back...
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Wait, you're...?
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Hey.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: That you? Ole' Gantt's boy?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: No wonder he sent me out here.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Look at you, your eyes glued to your terminal. You couldn't fix a washing machine before the clothes dry.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: I'm waiting for a job offer.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Young people like you always want to go out, leaving us old folks behind. Then we waste big bucks getting other people to fix things when they break down.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: It's crazy.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Good thing you've still got me.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Hey, you dropped your wrench!
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Stop standing there like an idiot and give me a hand.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Fine, fine, I'm coming.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Ouch... I bumped myself...
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Look at you, always messing up.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: *Sigh*...
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Oh? Junior's back?
attributes.name: Neighbor A

attributes.content: Hey, Jon, no need to come all the way to fix our lock then, just let Junior do it!
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: I—
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: You saying my hands don't work anymore?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Let me tell you, I can fix that old lock of yours even if they're trembling like a leaf!
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: C'mon, I just wanted to spare you the trouble, that's all.
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: This kid couldn't fix his way out of a matchbox.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Just sit tight, I'll be over when I'm done with this.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: I know how to fix locks. Maybe I should—
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Don't you dare look down on old people, kid.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: I'm not, Uncle Jon.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Hold on, I'll come and help after I put this down.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Tuesday
Hey there, Junior! You're back again!
attributes.name: Neighbor A

attributes.content: Yeah, I did promise to fix the stuff.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: What's this thing hanging here, Uncle William? Some kind of toy?
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Oh, that?
attributes.name: Neighbor A

attributes.content: It's from when my wife had just given birth to our daughter. We were both too busy to play with her, so we hung up a toy using some springs.
attributes.name: Neighbor A

attributes.content: The spring kept it swinging for ages whenever I closed the cabinet after coming back to fetch some stuff, and she used to love that.
attributes.name: Neighbor A

attributes.content: So I got in the habit of closing the door hard, to make it swing even longer.
attributes.name: Neighbor A

attributes.content: My little girl's all grown up and earning her own living now, but I guess my habit stuck. It's been a few years since I last saw her. Bus tickets don't come cheap, after all.
attributes.name: Neighbor A

attributes.content: But seeing this little thing reminds me of her, so I like to get someone to come fix it from time to time.
attributes.name: Neighbor A

attributes.content: Hold on, let me lubricate this a little more.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: I'll also add a small shock absorber here, and it'll last way longer.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: At the end of the day, though, it's still a bad habit.
attributes.name: Neighbor A

attributes.content: At least I'm doing well enough here with my wife, eh?
attributes.name: Neighbor A

attributes.content: Uncle Jon, you dropped your screwdriver!
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: ...Kid.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Are you throwing shade on my work?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Of course not!
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: But it'll last longer this way, and you won't have to come fix it so often.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: ...Guess your eyes ain't that bad.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: You can tell?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: I used to help out in the factory when I was little.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Just, you know, helping Mom and Dad pay my tuition.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: It was that big production line. Maybe you even saw me there.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: When you were little?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Hmph... My hands weren't for holding these tools when you were little.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Old Jon used to—
attributes.name: Neighbor A

attributes.content: (Inhales smoke)
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: *cough*...!
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Beep.
attributes.name: Terminal

attributes.content: 'From Mama John's...'
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Oh... it's just an ad.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Stop daydreaming, kid. We're working.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Er, alright...
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Wednesday
How're the legs, Old Jon? Your hand still hurt?
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: Meh, not great, not terrible.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: You did okay yesterday, kid. Try fixing this one today.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Alright.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: This lock... it's all worn and battered. Even if I fixed it up, it'd just break down again sooner or later.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Why don't you buy a new one?
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Ah, you wouldn't know since you've been away all these years.
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: My wife went to work in one of the nomadic cities. Says she's gonna make a fortune there before she comes back.
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: I keep the old lock around so her key will still work when she does.
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: Sending stuff by Messenger ain't cheap.
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: Not worth it just to send a key, and it's not like I have anything else to send either. Plus, she wouldn't be too happy about me wasting all that money on mail.
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: So I just keep my nose to the grindstone. Take things one day at a time, you know?
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: ...I see.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: But couldn't you get a new lock made for the same key?
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: With what money?
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: Not many people know how to make locks, and the price... Well, if I had the cash to spare I'd rather save it anyway.
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: Well, this won't be easy... let me take a look.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: You went to a famous university, didn't you, Junior? Let's see your work!
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: Famous university, huh...
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: (Inhales smoke)
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: A bright future for everyone!
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Beep.
attributes.name: Terminal

attributes.content: (Looks at terminal)
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Getting distracted again?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Well... it's hiring season, and a lot of companies are recruiting.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: ...Not that I've gotten any offers.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Don't worry. You're a good kid; it'll turn out alright in the end.
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: So eager to leave, though?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Yeah.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: I want to learn new things and bring them back.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: ...Not a bad attitude.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Just don't forget where you came from.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Hey, you dropped your screwdriver again!
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Thursday
Junior! Is it really true?
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: You made me a brand new lock? Wow!
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: Well... it wasn't too difficult.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: (Silently smokes a cigarette)
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Guess I really am getting old.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: After all these years fixing stuff for us, this is the first time I've heard you say that, Jon.
attributes.name: Neighbor B

attributes.content: (Silently smokes a cigarette)
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Wanna help me out, kid?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Sure, with what?
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: I have an old piano at home.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Oh!
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: This is a nice piano.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: But it doesn't look like it's been played in a long time.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Yeah...
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: The old man opens the fallboard, filling the air with dust.
Fingers mottled from decades of working with machine oil press the keys, and dull, out-of-tune notes come out.
It's been decades since I last played it.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: I still remember playing in big concert halls, filled with folks who came just to hear me.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: The old man plays a string of notes with trembling hands.
The sound of rustling cloth comes from inside the house, and an old but joyful voice speaks.
'Honey, is that you playing?'
You heard me, Marge?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Why don't you come out and dance?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Out-of-tune notes come from trembling fingers, the shell of a light-hearted dance.
The old woman lifts up the edges of her skirt, and starts dancing on tiptoes.
While she doesn't have much in the way of form or training, the old man cannot take his eyes off his wife's every little step and turn.
Gantt Jr. watches the scene with bated breath.
I looked everywhere for a doctor who could cure my hand, but eventually I gave up.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: So your hand is...
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Imagine getting a job, then realizing on the first day of work that you've forgotten how to do anything, but you still remember everything else.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: You remember the hard work, the glory, the achievements, but there's nothing left.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: My hands couldn't press the keys anymore, and I couldn't bear to look at a piano again, not even a single glance.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: No wonder you had that expression on your face when I said you might've seen me sneaking into the factory to help out when I was little.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Mom and Dad said everyone knew I was working there against the rules, but nobody said anything.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: ...They never said anything about me either.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: When I couldn't play anymore, my agency came after me, demanding a penalty fee that I had no hope of paying.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Who knew they hid all those terms and conditions in the contract? I wouldn't have been able to pay it even if I spent the rest of my life performing.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: So I hid from them here, in the dark corners of the warehouses. Then I met Marge.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: She hid me, fed me, and told me how beautiful the sunset outside was.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: So this piano...
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: I went back a little while ago and snuck it out from the old warehouse.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: I thought I'd never play it again... but Marge has started to lose her hearing.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: So I've been taking job after job to make the money to get it fixed while she can still hear it.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: When I said I didn't care for your work a few days ago... I didn't mean it, kid.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Can you help me fix the piano?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: I'm afraid we're running out of time.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: But I've never fixed a musical instrument.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: It's okay, sweetie, no need to force yourself.
attributes.name: Marge

attributes.content: We'd all end up like Jon used to be if we obsessed over fixing it. I keep telling him that it's the present that counts.
attributes.name: Marge

attributes.content: I'll always remember the tune, even if I can't hear anymore. It's not the end of the world.
attributes.name: Marge

attributes.content: Still, I'll try my best. Let me look into it.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: I was just thinking...
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: If I went through the same thing you guys did... I don't think I'd have been able to carry on.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: The moment that I found out I couldn't play the piano anymore, or that I couldn't hear anymore, I'd have given up on my goals in life.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: I can't imagine what could keep me going.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: But what I just saw from you two... it really touched me.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Gantt Jr. gazes at the sweat on their two aged brows.
Sorry if this sounds offensive, but... if a broken star can continue to shine in the night, why can't I?
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Heh. Counting on you, kid.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Friday
I can tune it myself. The problem is the parts. Some of the hammers don't move anymore.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Let me see... must be the lever action here.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Do you have a pair of curved nose pliers? I want to adjust the screws here.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Here, a new spring.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Okay, leave it here. This is the hammer, right? It's supposed to bounce back like this?
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Exactly!
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Sorry, I need a break... Why don't you stay for dinner, kid?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: (Marge will eventually lose her hearing, won't she?)
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: (How long will these repairs last?)
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: You heard me, Marge?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Why don't you come out and dance?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: (Fixing the piano won't help much, if things end up the same anyway.)
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: (If only Marge could see the sound from the piano...)
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: A little fowlbeast down shouldn't affect the sound of the strings.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: An attachment here won't affect the tone either.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: I don't know if they'll like the color, but it's the same shade of blue as Marge's skirt that day.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: It won't be easy finding the same dye, and I'm not sure about my artistic talent... but everyone likes feathers and ribbons, right?
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Gantt Jr. presses a few keys, and an elaborate device conducts the resonance of the strings to the feathers and ribbons outside, creating a beautiful arc.
The first rays of dawn shine through the windows and onto the piano.
Whew—
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: I hope they like what I did.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Saturday
Would you like to try it?
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: I didn't change anything that was already there. I can easily remove it if you want.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Sorry, it's an idea I had last night, so I just gave it a shot without asking.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: (Presses a key)
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: No, kid... It's beautiful.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Did you choose this blue for the ribbons on purpose?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: It's the color of Marge's eyes...
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: (Plays a song)
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: The lights shine bright in the factory tonight♪
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Like the sunset when I spoke my love to you♪
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: I can hear it, honey... I used to sing this song when I got off work.
attributes.name: Marge

attributes.content: You would follow behind me like this...
attributes.name: Marge

attributes.content: (Dances in lithe steps)
attributes.name: Marge

attributes.content: Gantt Jr. feels like he is seeing the couple in their youth.
Jon in a tuxedo, Marge dancing to the tune, her skirt spinning in the factory.
(Did I finally achieve something?)
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: The old man switches over to a delicate tune.
What are you thinking, kid?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: I was thinking... maybe I should go into the factory tomorrow... the production line... I've been thinking about it...
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Oh, sorry, I'm babbling.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: I was thinking, maybe I could do something about that production line... the line that Mom and Dad always worked on.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: I remember staring at the conveyor belt, lifting up the stuff as it came along, turning it over, and putting it back if it passed inspection. It was inefficient and exhausting.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: I want to modify it. Tomorrow.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Weren't you waiting for a job offer from someplace else?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: You're planning to stay here, then? What about the factory owner?
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: No, I'm still waiting. I still want to leave.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Then...
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: I've just always wanted to make changes to the factory.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Actually, it's my whole reason to keep pushing forward.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: ...I thought you young folks went out just to make more money. I thought you didn't care what happened to old things like us who stayed behind.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: You're different from the others, kid.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Not really...
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: The old man stops playing.
What I want the most is just to make money, climb the ranks, and get into a good company. I resent those who took away my opportunities. That's the kind of ordinary guy I am.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: But when I was fixing that lock, Uncle Mason said he didn't want to change it, so his wife could still use her key when she comes back. I've heard a lot of stories like that.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: 'Don't worry, I've already eaten.' 'These pants still look trendy.'
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Truth is, we don't have a choice. We say those things to make ourselves feel better.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: I started out just wanting to learn some tricks to make things easier on the production line.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Make my parents' workload lighter, so we could make more money and live in a bigger house.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: It's enough that you haven't forgotten that.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: I've been thinking, though. Should I deny everything I've worked for and not help other people, just because I haven't gotten a job offer from an outside company?
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: (Smokes quietly) You wouldn't be the first person to back yourself into a corner.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: I would've died alone out there, if not for Marge.
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: I was too obsessed with the process. That's why I was acting like that when I got back a few days ago.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: It was a simple question, but I trapped myself in a corner.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: He lets out a self-deprecating laugh, but there is a glimmer in his eyes.
If I modified those production lines, Uncle William might have the money to buy a ticket to see his daughter, and Uncle Mason might be able to send a new key and who-knows-what-else to his wife.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: He breathes out.
I won't be able to help you out the next few days, but I'll be back once I'm finished at the factory.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: You're such a good kid...
attributes.name: Old Worker

attributes.content: Marge could not hear what the two were saying. She leans by a window, watching the sunset, then turns around joyfully when Jon starts playing the piano again.
She takes Gantt Jr.'s hands.
Don't just stand there, sweetie.
attributes.name: Marge

attributes.content: Come on, while I can still hear the sound of the piano, while I can still dance, while the sunset still lingers.
attributes.name: Marge

attributes.content: Let's dance.
attributes.name: Marge

attributes.content: The lights shine bright in the factory tonight♪
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Like the sunset when I spoke my love to you♪
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Beep.
attributes.name: Terminal

attributes.content: *Bzzzt*
attributes.name: Terminal

attributes.content: Huh, guess I left my terminal at home.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: 15 unread messages. All ads. Last checked... 3 days ago?
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: I forgot about it for that long?
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Haha...
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: The stars are shining so bright.
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: What should I fix tomorrow?
attributes.name: Gantt Jr.

attributes.content: Gantt Jr. lies down on the bed, aching from a whole day of work.
He stares at the ceiling, where some of the paint has begun to peel off.
He closes his eyes and soon falls asleep.
In his dreams, he has taken over the operations of the factory. Everyone has new uniforms—including those hard hats worn by the workers on the posters—and lives in warm and spacious homes.
He turns over, a smile on his face, and knocks over a jar of medicine by his bedside.
Beep.
attributes.name: Terminal
